titleStmt.title: Hickman Pelly to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6863

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
August 1st 1865
adair county Ky Mr Thomas.E. Bramblett

govenor of Kentucky Milton B. cox now in the state prison was charged with Robing george walker in adair county of some money in the night owing to the polilal Exitement Excate and great conflict in the Evidence there is some douts about his gilt in the publick sentiment in this county at Least with the Law abiding union men it may becom nessary for the Exative power of the state to interpose in order that Justice as well as murcy may take place in some of those predigest countys
I think its one of those cases the Exative ought to consider and Look into yourse Trooly --
